item.title: Deploying on Digital Ocean
item.description: Steps Pay my digital ocean bills (oops) Set up GitHub repository Use DigitalOcean App feature to link up to GitHub repo Starter package lets you deploy up to 3 static sites for free Deploy from GitHub, custom domain, and automatic https Set up domain as round2.anich003.me (let DigitalOcean manage domain & nameservers) Notes This was technically easy mode deployment since I didn’t have to fuss with building the site locally and uploading files to a machine that is hosting a webserver.

item.title: Introduction to Hugo and Static Site Generation
item.description: Steps to create project Start a new hugo “site” by running hugo new site <name> cd <name> Add a theme by cloning a theme repo into /themes then adding line to config.toml Add content with hugo new <content>/<name-of-article>.md Build static pages with hugo -D which will build to /public/ by default
